definition: to lose/to leave behind/to omit/to bequeath/sth lost/involuntary discharge (of urine etc)

sentences.english: From which dynasty was the blue---flower porcelain plate in the Hall of Happiness and Longevity left?
sentences.chinese: 頤和園樂壽堂內的青花大磁盤是哪個朝代的遺物？

sentences.english: First day at work, Ouyang went to the office to arrange Hao relics.
sentences.chinese: 上班的第一天，歐陽去辦公室整理昊的遺物。

sentences.english: The sides of the reliquary are about an inch long and it is 73 percent gold.
sentences.chinese: 這個遺物箱大約一英寸長，含金量爲73%。

sentences.english: This stone axe is a relic of the Old Stone Age.
sentences.chinese: 這把石斧是舊石器時代的遺物。

sentences.english: Yet relics of the past are good business here.
sentences.chinese: 然而過去的遺物在這裏是個好買賣。

sentences.english: Only three other reliquaries of this type are known to have survived.
sentences.chinese: 目前此類的遺物箱世間倖存的僅三件。

sentences.english: Mother's sons and daughters in total of eight circled around the side of sofa, arranging belongings she left.
sentences.chinese: 母親的八個兒女圍在沙發邊，整理她的遺物。

sentences.english: Conversation is a relic of a bygone age.
sentences.chinese: 和別人對話已經成爲上個時代的遺物了。

sentences.english: It is a holdover from lazy traditional thinking.
sentences.chinese: 它是懶惰的傳統思想的遺物。

sentences.english: The ploughman turned up some relics of ancient times.
sentences.chinese: 這個農民從土裏犁出了些古代遺物。

sentences.english: He attributes this pottery to the Bronze age.
sentences.chinese: 他認爲這種陶器是青銅時代的遺物。

sentences.english: Like magical artifacts, these are legendary relics that whole campaigns can be based around.
sentences.chinese: 如同魔法神器一樣，整個戰役可以基於這些傳奇遺物。

sentences.english: A relic said to be worn by a famous dual wielding assassin.
sentences.chinese: 據說是一個著名雙持刺客以前使用過遺物。

sentences.english: East hall large amount of column arch eye on the pieces of wall paintings, are also relics of the Tang Dynasty.
sentences.chinese: 東大殿內柱額上的幾幅拱眼壁畫，亦爲唐代遺物。

sentences.english: Framers occasionally ploughed out old Indian relics.
sentences.chinese: 農民偶爾能犁出古老的印弟安人的遺物。

definition: to lose/to leave behind/to omit/to bequeath/sth lost/involuntary discharge (of urine etc)
to take down (in writing)/notes/a type of literature consisting mainly of short sketches/CL:本[ben3]
handed down from ancient times/family heirloom
specimen/sample/the root cause and symptoms of a disease
covered in dust/dusty/lying unused for a long time
to collect in a museum or library/museum collection/library holdings
